title: What is the effective discount (in %) on two successive discounts of 20% and 10%? - Quora

response.answer_text: Friends….! Let the amount on which two successive discounts applicable be ₹100 After first successive discount of 20% it's price will be 20/100 × 100 = ₹20 Price after 20% discount = 100 - 20 = ₹80 After 2nd successive discount of 10% it's price 10/100 × 80 = 80/10 = ₹8 Price after 2nd successive discount = ₹80 - 8 = ₹72 Total discount = 100 - 72 = 28 As the amount of ₹28 has been based on ₹100 as such the percentage dis puny after two successive discount of 20% and 10% it will be 28% Answer the effective discount (in %) on two successive discounts of 20% and 10% will be 28%

Let us assume the initial price be x. After first discount of 20%, Discount = 20% of x = 0.2x Price = 80% of x = 0.8 x After 2nd discount of 10%, Discount = 10% of 0.8x = 0.08x Price = 90% of 0.8x = 0.72x Effective discount = 0.2x + 0.08x = 0.28x = 28% OR Simpler way to calculate: Effective discount percentage = [math][{20 \over 100} + {10 \over 100} \times (1-{20 \over 100})] \times 100[/math] [math]= {{0.2} + 0.1 (1 -0.2)} \times 100[/math] [math]= {0.2 + 0.1 (0.8)} \times 100[/math] [math]= 28%[/math]
